trans-unit.source: The original date that employer posted the job in ISO 8601 format. For example, "2017-01-24" or "2017-01-24T19:33:17+00:00".

The full description of the job in HTML format. The description should be a complete representation of the job, including job responsibilities, qualifications, skills, working hours, education requirements, and experience requirements. The description can't be the same as the title.
The organization offering the job position. This should be the name of the company, and not the specific location that is hiring.
The website of the organization offering the job position.
If you have a third-party job site, you can provide a different logo for a given organization than the image shown in the organization's Knowledge Graph card.
The physical location(s) of the business where the employee will report to work.
The title of the job. For example, "Software Engineer" or "Barista".
The date when the job posting will expire in ISO 8601 format. For example, "2017-02-24".
The currency of the base salary for the job.
For the unitText of the base salary, use one of the following case-sensitive values: "HOUR","DAY","WEEK","MONTH","YEAR"
The actual base salary for the job, as provided by the employer (not an estimate).
Set this property with the value TELECOMMUTE for jobs in which the employee may or must work remotely 100% of the time.
The country in which employees may be located for to be eligible for the remote job.
